discourse_list.title: Use DAI surplus to pay for some tx fees when someone sends DAI

content.content: I’m not sure how this would work tbh, but I think it would be cool if anytime a user sends DAI to someone else (not borrow through a Vault), the protocol would pay part of, or all, of the tx fees. I think the protocol might figure out how many DAI transfer txs are there in total, so to then figure out what percentage of the fees it can pay for each user. That the tx fees be cheaper for sending DAI than sending other tokens, would increase DAI popularity in my opinion.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes that the protocol pays for part or all of the transaction fees when someone sends DAI to someone else. The author suggests that this would increase the popularity of DAI. The post also invites feedback and questions about the proposal.
